meanings.definition: A game in which one player gives a word or line of verse to which each of the others must find a rhyme.
meanings.sent1: During the party, we played a fun game of cramboes where we had to come up with rhymes.
meanings.sent2: The children enjoyed the challenge of finding rhymes in the cramboes game.
meanings.sent3: In the cramboes game, Sarah rhymed 'cat' with 'hat' and won the round.
meanings.sent4: The cramboes competition was fierce as everyone tried to outdo each other with clever rhymes.
meanings.sent5: Playing cramboes made the party lively and full of laughter.

meanings.sent1: She wrote a beautiful cramboes for her best friend's birthday card.
meanings.sent2: The poet's masterpiece was filled with intricate cramboes that captivated the audience.
meanings.sent3: The cramboes in the song made it catchy and easy to remember.
meanings.sent4: His clever cramboes in the rap lyrics impressed everyone who listened.
meanings.sent5: The teacher asked the students to create their own cramboes as a creative writing exercise.
